MVC

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • MVC.View
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class View
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    View: Contains everything about graphics and images Know size of screen, which images to load etc
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getPlayerSprite

        private Sprite.ID getPlayerSprite()
        Determines which Sprite.ID to use to render the player. Determines this based on the player's status and direction.
        Parameters:
        None. -
        Returns:
        The appropriate Sprite.ID to use to render the player

      • drawImage

        private void drawImage(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       Sprite.ID s,
                       int world_x,
                       int world_y)
        Renders a Sprite.ID onto the given Graphics by consuming world coordinates. Does all conversions necessary to render at the correct pixel coordinates.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to use for painting.
        s - The Sprite.ID to use to retrieve the BufferedImage to draw.
        world_x - The x-coordinate of the Sprite.ID to draw, in world coordinates.
        world_y - The y-coordinate of the Sprite.ID to draw, in world coordinates.

      • drawString

        private void drawString(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        java.lang.String word,
                        int width,
                        int XPos,
                        int YPos)
        Draws a string centered in the specified horizontal line by consuming world coordinates.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to use for painting.
        word - The text to render.
        width - The length of the line on which to render the text
        XPos - the x-coordinate of the left endpoint of the line, in world coordinates.
        YPos - the y-coordinate of the left endpoint of the line, in world coordinates.

      • worldXToPixelX

        private int worldXToPixelX(int world_x)
        Consumes a x-coordinate in world coordinates, computes the expected x-coordinate in the window (i.e. pixel coordinates).
        Parameters:
        world_x - The x-coordinate in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate in pixel coordinates.

      • worldYToPixelY

        private int worldYToPixelY(int world_y)
        Consumes a y-coordinate in world coordinates, computes the expected y-coordinate in the window (i.e. pixel coordinates).
        Parameters:
        world_y - The y-coordinate in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate in pixel coordinates.

      • getFrameWidth

        private int getFrameWidth()
        Returns the width in pixels of the inner frame.
        Returns:
        The width of the inner frame in pixels.

      • getFrameHeight

        private int getFrameHeight()
        Returns the height in pixels of the inner frame.
        Returns:
        The height of the inner frame in pixels.

      • getFrameHorizOffset

        private int getFrameHorizOffset()
        Returns the distance in pixels between a side of the window and the inner frame. Can be 0 if the inner frame size is contrained by the width of the window.
        Returns:
        The distance between a side of the window and a side of the inner frame

      • getFrameVertOffset

        private int getFrameVertOffset()
        Returns the distance in pixels between the top/bottom of the window and the inner frame. Can be 0 if the inner frame size is contrained by the height of the window.
        Returns:
        The distance between the top/bottom of the window and the top/bottom of the inner frame.

      • getFrameDimensions

        private java.awt.Dimension getFrameDimensions()
        Returns the dimensions of the inner frame in pixels.
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the inner frame in pixels.

      • update

        public void update(int playerX,
                   int playerY,
                   Direction dir,
                   PlayerStatus status,
                   int crabX,
                   int crabY,
                   Litter playerPickedUp,
                   boolean hasLitter,
                   Litter animalEatenLitter,
                   int score)
        Updates the View based on the given parameters. Updates the player's location, direction, and status. Updates the crab's position. Updates the most recently held Litter, whether the player is currently holding a Litter, and the most recent Litter eaten by the animal. Updates the current game score.
        Parameters:
        playerX - The Player's X-location in world coordinates.
        playerY - The Player's Y-location in world coordinates.
        dir - The current Direction of the Player.
        status - The Player's current status.
        crabX - The Animal's X-location in world coordinates.
        crabY - The Animal's Y-location in world coordinates.
        playerPickedUp - The most recent Litter object picked up by the Player
        hasLitter - Boolean value representing if the Player is currently holding a Litter object.
        animalEatenLitter - The most recent Litter object eaten by the animal.
        score - Current score of the game.

      • addLitter

        public void addLitter(Litter l)
        Adds a Litter object to the other Litter objects being rendered on the View
        Parameters:
        l - The Litter object that will be added for rendering.

      • getSpriteID

        public Sprite.ID getSpriteID(Litter l)
        Chooses a Sprite ID to represent a Litter object. The type of Litter image is chosen using the Litter's enum attribute that represents type, specific image chosen is done using the Litter object's imgID
        Parameters:
        l - the Litter object whose Sprite ID will be chosen.
        Returns:
        Sprite ID representing the parameter.

      • preloadLitterImgs

        public void preloadLitterImgs()
        Loads in the different Litter images to be used in the game.
        Parameters:
        None. -
